nodes.text: The Holocron of Odan-Urr was a holocron constructed by the Jedi Master Odan-Urr at some point before his death in 3996 BBY. The holocron, which contained his teachings, was lost sometime in the years that followed, though it was rediscovered by the Jedi Master and archaeologist Yuon Par sometime before 3643 BBY. By 3628 BBY, the holocron was stored in the Great Jedi Library on the planet Ossus along with other Jedi artifacts, though its safety came under threat during the invasion of Ossus in that year.

The Holocron of Odan-Urr was first mentioned in the Codex entry for Yuon Par in Star Wars: The Old Republic, a video game released by BioWare and LucasArts in 2011. It later appeared in the 2018 "Jedi Under Siege" expansion as one of the items that Republic players must recover as part of the Daily quest "The Sacred Artifacts."
